page.title: 02SUMMARY & STATISTICS PT. 2
page.content: The age structure of the populattion is shown by the following statistics from the 1981 census:_ The number of children of school age (under 16) was {10.01%}of the total population; this compares with the figure for Ipswich, a more normal town, of{22.41%. The number of people of pensionable age was{47.15%,}compared with Ipswich {18.49%. Southwold is above all a town for quite rich people to retire to. The population of Reydon over the same period showed a steady increase:- 1921 {1093 1931 {981 1951 {1447 1961 {1527 1971 {2136 1981 {2210 Reydon can be considered as a suburb of Southwold with spare building land.
